text: North Korea relies on front companies
military partnerships and deception on
the high seas to skirt international
sanctions and a UN arms embargo here's a
closer look glow calm cells military
communications gear via its website but
according to UN investigators glow calm
is a front company tied to North Korea's
spy agency these glow calm products
right here were intercepted on route to
Eritrea in 2016 the company's profits
allegedly generate revenue for North
Korea the US says North Korea is using
deceptive shipping tactics to defy
sanctions here's one example according
to US intelligence a ship sets off from
China declaring that it's headed for
Russia as it enters North Korean waters
it turns off its transponder that's
making it essentially invisible to
shipping trackers the ship then likely
docks in North Korea and takes on a load
of coal this is coal that China
reportedly stopped buying after UN
sanctions last year back at sea the
ships transponder turns back on as it
rounds South Korea it makes its way to
Vladivostok Russia and sits in port for
about a day the ship then returns to
China where the US says the ban North
Korean coal is likely offloaded North
Korea does a lot of business with
countries willing to defy sanctions the
UN is investigating North Korea's
training of Air Force personnel in
Uganda it's 12 million in contracts to
provide maintenance for the Tanzanian
military and its cooperation with Syria
on chemical and conventional weapons the
US has urged all countries to implement
the UN sanctions quote aggressively
you
